[html]

Actual situation: all bbarea fields have now
<p></p>
tags around text (you can manually change it to
<div> </div>,
but reductact tags are still there)

Why is it problem?

If your markup is for example (problems with W3C validation):

<h3>{CMENUBODY} </h3> - Error: Element p not allowed as child of element h3 in this context.

OR
<p class="featured-desc">{CMENUBODY}</p> - Error: No p element in scope but a p end tag seen.

So what to do? Override core CMENUBODY shortcode in theme shortcodes.

  1. add add theme_shortcodes class $override variable (before _construct() )

var $override = true;

  1. add new method:
function sc_cmenubody($parm='')
{
    $sc   = e107::getScBatch('page', null, 'cpage');
    $data = $sc->getVars();                
    $text =  e107::getParser()->toHTML(vartrue($data['menu_text'],''), true, 'BODY');  
    $text =  str_replace(array("<!-- bbcode-html-start --><p>","</p><!-- bbcode-html-end -->"), "", $text);
    return $text; 
}

It's done. Just remember that all CMENUBODY is now without
<p></p>
tags, so you need to use
<p>{CMENUBODY}</p>
anywhere in template

[/html]

[html]

Sometimes you want to display menu without title. You can add template for it, but after some time it can get messy.  

This solution is very often used in WP for not displaying widget title, so I willl start to use it my themes and reduced numbers of templates. 

How to do it:

1. add this function to theme.php  (source code is in my starter theme pack)

/**
* @param string $caption
* @example []Heading 1
* @example [Heading2]
* @return empty string if correct syntax is used
*/
function checkcaption( $caption )
{
 // get rid of any leading and trailing spaces
 $title = trim( $caption );
 // check the first and last character, if [ and ] set the title to empty - this always doesn't work because admin stuff in captions
 if ( $title[0]== '[' && $title[strlen($title) - 1] == ']' ) $title = '';
 // so just put [] at the beginning of menu title
 if ( $title[0]== '[' && $title[1] == ']' ) $title = '';
 return $title;
}

2. just advice, but in tablestyle() you should always check if $caption is filled and only then use pre-title and after-title parts. 

if(!empty($caption))
{
echo '<h2>'.$caption.'</h2>';
}

3. insert you title in data with []your title just for you not displayed on frontend

[/html]

[html]

If you need to install e107 without prefix or with different prefixs, you can do it after installation in e107_config.php or before installation.  If you prefer later option, you need:

BEFORE

- rewrite folder's names

- open install.php and change 2 lines (look for e107_handlers and e107_admin) 

$HANDLERS_DIRECTORY  = "e107_handlers/"; // needed for e107 class init
require_once("e107_admin/ver.php");

- open e107_class.php in you new handlers folder, find public function defaultDirs()  and change directory names there

Run installation process.

If your installation screen looks bad, it means you forgot to change something. (blank page - e107_handler, bad look - e107_themes folder etc)

AFTER

After installation open .htaccess file and change e107_images and e107_files.  Of course delete install.php.

Next core update is not problem, because after installation e107 works with configuration in e107_config.php.

[/html]

[html]

Just note. If you want to change folder name after installation, you need to add this to e107_config.php:

$CORE_DIRECTORY = 'core/';
$WEB_DIRECTORY = 'web/';

And of course, changing .htaccess and then to get new hash folders in media and system folder (resave prefs and clear cache).

[/html]

[html]

After installation there is sitelink with /index.php to homepage, but url only with Siteurl works too.  To have just one version of the homepage url, use this as URL for homepage:   

{SITEURL}
[/html]

[html]
Warning. This is only my way.  In fact, I am used with plugin to use local (batch) and global (e_shortcodes) together, so this can be simplified by using just one of them.

Real example:

Plugin name:  pnews

Local shortcodes in shortcodes/batch folder

File name:  pnews_shortcodes.php

Class name and definition:

class plugin_pnews_pnews_shortcodes extends news_shortcodes {}  

Global e_shortcodes:

class pnews_shortcodes extends plugin_pnews_pnews_shortcodes {}

You can override existing shortcodes or add new ones. Plugin global ones you can override via theme shortcodes.

Using:

$sc = e107::getScBatch('pnews');

---

$sc->setVars($row);  $sc->setScVar('news_item', $row);

It really works. I can use in plugin template core news shortcodes, customized core news shortcodes, my local shortcodes and my global shortcodes.

Awesome.  I was just looking at result and I couldn't believe. 

[/html]

[html]

e_classifieds plugin doesn't work without prototype plugin, but only reason I was able to find was message functionality.  To remove php errors without any other changes in new version:

before:

$prototype_obj->message_box($eclassf_msgtype, $eclassf_msgtext)

after 

e107::getMessage()->add($eclassf_msgtext, $eclassf_msgtype)->render()

It's all for now.

[/html]

[html]

DHTML Calendar is not part of e107 anymore, but there are old plugin that use it.

1. delete old code (example, could be used different way):

require_once(e_HANDLER."calendar/calendar_class.php");
$cal = new DHTML_Calendar(true);
global $cal;
$cal->load_files();


2. replace old code :

$text .= $cal->make_input_field($cal_options, $cal_attrib);


with

$text .= e107::getForm()->datepicker($cal_attrib['name'], $cal_attrib['value']);


or

$eclassf_desc = $eclassf_cal->make_input_field($eclassf_cal_options, $eclassf_cal_attrib);


with

$eclassf_desc = e107::getForm()->datepicker($eclassf_cal_attrib['name'], $eclassf_cal_attrib['value']);


It's all.

[/html]

Used Smart Menus script for this, so some notes while I remember them
Hestia has position menu to the right with navbar-right
but using this class causes that 3rd and 4th level are going to the left side (like RTL).
Without class navbar-right menu items are displayed on the right side.
So for combination right navbar and submenus on the left - class navbar-to-right is used in header template (the same style as navbar-right but smartmenu script doesn't detect that you want to submenus on the left side.

[html]

Warning: there is a lot of debug now because there are some related issues. Before release, it should be solved.

Theme shortcodes for the parent theme are the same for all themes. The only version is different. You use version 2. If you need to do changes to this file, something is wrong and it should be reported. Imagine it as a replacement for some core missing functionality (and you can't do it with plugin now)

Methods available in parent theme shortcodes:

- parent_header() and parent_footer() - if you use JMLayout plugin, it inserts headers/footers instead {---HEADER---}  and {---FOOTER---}

- sc_default_menuarea() - a shortcode for inserting menus of default layout on all layouts without setting them for each layout separately

- sc_layout_bgimage() - if you use JMLayout plugin, it inserts layout background image (the same functionality as in JMTheme plugin, only now there are 3 templates available by default)

- sc_layout_element() - if you use JMLayout plugin, it inserts a custom field related to the layout (the same functionality as in JMTheme plugin - fields in layout setting)

 - sc_theme_menu() - insert theme menu. If you have a special menu for the theme only, it can be used with this shortcode.  Of course, the menu is not supported by the Menu manager, but with using the shortcode menu, you can use it too. Example: {THEME_MENU: path=chapternavigation}

- sc_theme_path() - if you need path to parent theme. For normal theme there is core shortcode {THEME} for HTML layouts.

- sc_layout_header() - if you don't use JMLayout plugin, you can set any header from any theme in your layout files.  In testing mode. Waiting for solving related issues. 

- sc_layout_footer() - if you don't use JMLayout plugin, for footer, coming soon

- sc_theme_pref() - for inserting theme preference value as shortcode. Example: {THEME_PREF: code=header_width&default=container}

[/html]
Thank you for the work so far.

[html]

I just remembered why I prefered to use the parent theme for assets.  When you want to save time and copy all images to your theme from HTML theme, all are imported to the media manager without asking. With hundreds of images, it could be really annoying. 

So because I don't use parent theme, don't copy img folder, just images that are needed...

I really don't understand why only images in the install folder can't be imported without asking. Already issue on github.

[/html]

[html]

Next step. Copy stuff from css, js, vendor - skip sass - and fix theme.php - check vieport, css and js path. 

I use methods set_metas() register_css() and register_js() in theme class. I have already prepared constants for paths to the assets folder, so I used them, but you can change it from 
"url" to "theme" parameter.  But if you use "url" with javascript, it will be loaded in the header, so "footer" has to be used. 

There is a constant for e107_config for putting JQuery to the footer too. I am not able to remember the name now and it is not documented. 

Don't forget to check if core bootstrap4 and fontawesome 5 are loaded. We use libraries for now. Core uses an older bootstrap4 version than your theme.

Your site should have changed look now.

[/html]

[html]

Now header.  The easiest way:

copy logo.svg to img folder

copy HTML header to theme.html (replace {NAVIGATION} and {---HEADER---}}

change path to image {THEME}assets/

You have a static header now, but you will know that it is e107 related if something is wrong. 

Do footer too, this was too easy.

image and path to image was needed to change: {THEME}assets/img/logo-footer.svg

Add HTML markup to layouts too.

Home uses sections, so no markup for now. Full is just container and default is with sidebar. I suppose they will be changed later

[/html]

[html]

Finalizing header part

- create headers folder on parent/core theme. Create file header_default.html

- copy there the header code from theme.html and replace it with:

{LAYOUT_HEADER: layout=default&theme=juliette-core}

This way the same header is used for all pages. If you need to separate headers, move this shortcode to layouts file. It works too.

If you need to customized this header, copy it to your final theme in the same position: juliette/headers/header_default.html and change shortcode to:

{LAYOUT_HEADER: layout=default&theme=juliette}

You can rename it, if file name is f.e. header_custom.html, then shortcode will be:

{LAYOUT_HEADER: layout=custom&theme=juliette}

DONE. 

[/html]

Hi some steps. [b]1. you need to find correct setting/styling from the source [/b] (in your case forum) and test if it's correct.

in most case this is enough for your developer - you need to have font-size 16px [b]2. you need to find correct element (you can't change all a elements). [/b] This is a bit advanced. I made video for you, but I loaded sensitive information by mistake, so I can use only images. - that needed tag is "a" - but it has no class or ID, nothing. It's generated by shortcode, so it's not easy to change it (I should look if you can send class as parameter). - but all menu has unique class newforumposts-menu-scroll, so this can be used. 3. you need to change your css file This [prism].newforumposts-menu-scroll a { font: 16px Arial, Helvetica, Sans-serif; } [/prism] can change all urls in menu. So I get inspired by forum css and result was: [prism].newforumposts-menu-scroll table.table > tbody > tr > td > a { font: 16px Arial, Helvetica, Sans-serif; }[/prism] It didn't help, all "a" in table are bigger. So again I checked forum css and I found that there is tag used for author name. [img]https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5429548/45216746-e8cc9300-b2a1-11e8-9f5f-826a04880568.png[/img] 4. fix the result [img]https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5429548/45216793-10236000-b2a2-11e8-95b2-a510ccd32a3e.png[/img] Final: [img]https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5429548/45216823-30531f00-b2a2-11e8-9799-ef42fefd831e.png[/img]

You need the order field, it needs be integer, not varchar (many old plugins use text field for ordering)

your_order int(10) default NULL,

for this field use type number and data int:

'type' => 'number', 'data'=> 'int',

In your admin_ui class add read parameters for options:

'options' => array(... 'readParms'=>'sort=1')

Change $listOrder variable (default is generated primary key - id)

protected $listOrder = 'your_order asc';

Add $sortField variable

protected $sortField = 'your_order';

Add $orderStep variable

protected $orderStep = 1;

Note: Reordering is done only on displayed records, maybe you need to change $perPage variable

[/html]

https://www.e107.org/developer-manual/theme-basics/upgrading-v1.x-themes

Here are steps I used to get old theme Race work correctly with Theme manager and Menu manager without big effort:

1. you need theme.xml file

Way how to get it: 

copy from other theme and replace related things or use convert tools for it Theme Manager. 

There is problem how to fill some fields so look at other themes to get inspired.

There is problem because there are 2 layouts and Menu Manager doesn't work.

2. you need to fix layouts in generated theme.xml

- check for all  $CUSTOMPAGES[] in your theme.php and add them as layout

- set custompages for saving your time. You can change this in theme manager.

[/html]

[html]

3. fix theme.php  

1.  replace variables $HEADER and $FOOTER  (to rid warning about using deprecated headers and footers).

Each custompage's header and footer needs use different variable name (in my case $OLDFOOTER01,  $OLDFOOTER02, but header is the same for all pages, so just $OLDHEADER)

2. add new headers and footers for version 2

$LAYOUT['_header_'] = '';

$LAYOUT['_footer_']  = '';

If you have one version of header, you can use it directly.

3. add new layouts (according theme.xml)

add $LAYOUT['default']  with {---} 

add all needed layouts according theme.xml

add correct footers 

Menu manager is now fixed.

Important:  Check if Go button displays Menu areas, if not, something is wrong.

Correct result:

[img width=600]{e_MEDIA_IMAGE}2018-06/race06.png[/img]

[/html]

[html]

4. Add menus to new layout

This is new in version 2, each layout has the separate set of menus. 

Warning:  Be sure that you set correct default layout in Theme Manager at the beginning. If you change it later, you will do this again. 

Just check what menus are used for default and add the same menus with the same config for new layout.

Be sure you are on the correct layout and be aware that menu left checked after you add it to layout, so without unchecking you add it again with new menu.

[/html]

Troubleshooting

You did everything right and it still doesn't work as should be?

In my case  url /forum/  displays wrong layout.

1. how to check what layout is really used? 

- open page source and find body tag.

<body id='layout-default' >

So default layout is used and fix is in Theme Manager (Site theme)

2. how to fix correct layout?

in my case needed layout has this definition when to use it:

<span>page.php e107_plugins/ submitnews.php download.php upload.php forum.php forum_post.php forum_viewtopic.php user.php usersettings.php</span>

but my url is /forum/ so changing forum.php to forum is fix 

<body id='layout-no-right-menu-area' >

Go to Menu manager and check if menus are there.

This message:

[img width=600]{e_MEDIA_IMAGE}2018-06/race_delete00.png[/img]

means that you are using plugins that can damage your site. From safety reason you don't see them in Plugin manager (you don't see folder with 2 underscores __  and core renamed those folders)

Uninstall button doesn't work.

You need to manually delete them via FTP  (note: it;s done)

and remove them from plugin table in database.

Go to phpMyAdmin (or any other tool you use for database administration from your hosting).  Be sure your database is correct (not delete this on v1 site)

- find table prefix_plugin (in my case e107_plugin)

[img width=600]{e_MEDIA_IMAGE}2018-06/race_delete01.png[/img]

- find record jshelper in column plugin_path (f.e. click on title, sort it alpabetically)

[img width=600]{e_MEDIA_IMAGE}2018-06/race_delete02.png[/img]

- delete it (I have it already deleted, so I can't show it)

You can delete cl_widgets record too; it will be next message after you remove jshelper.

Go to your admin dashboard to be sure that there are not next warning messages.

[/html]

Just to have it complet. It's not enough. Core pref needs to be fixed (rescan plugin directory didn't help)

  • Export core pref with Database/Tools/Export
  • Open xml file in File editor
  • Find plug_installed pref
  • Remove needed plugin
  • Save 
  • Import back via Database/Tools/Import

by this:

elseif(USER)
{

}
else
{
define('e_TINYMCE_TEMPLATE', 'public');
}

If you want to edit template (or made new one) , go to e107_plugins/tinymce4/templates, copy someone f.e. admin.xml to forumadmin.xml (change template name above).

If you need to your tinymce editor supports more bbcodes (otherwise it will strip them), add them here:

<extended_valid_elements>i[*], object[*],embed[*],bbcode[*], sp[*]</extended_valid_elements>

This applies only for forum posts.  After looking at code in wysiwyg.php, it would be enough to remove definition of e_TINYMCE_TEMPLATE.  Then standard templates will be applied.

just recap. 

Possible reasons:

-  I did mistake while using old templates (and adding them to template arrays)

or

- original template can't be used from some reason.

How to check this:

- copy complet code from v 1.0.4 to theme template (no arrays)

- open forum_viewforum.php file and move this line 

require_once(THEME.'templates/forum/forum_viewforum_template.php');

above 

if (empty($FORUM_VIEW_START))

so template is loaded as the first. 

this is just for debug, it can't stay this way.

This way your template will be work with old template code and without array.

Result:  double post, so problem is in code itself, not in update. 

this is bug, by the way, you shouldn't do this manually, I created issue.

[/html]

[html]

How to find what is wrong?

Easy, just compare theme template (or old one) with core v2 template.  

{SUBFORUMS} are used just one in v2  -

 $FORUM_VIEW_START_CONTAINER

{SUBFORUMS} are used 2x in version 1 ,

$FORUM_VIEW_START_CONTAINER, $FORUM_VIEW_START

And because I have already updated for arrays, I just removed it there.

$FORUM_VIEWFORUM_TEMPLATE['start']

[/html]

I just noticed this, so this is an example:
- why not use canonical URLs by original metatag plugin (and why I added new token [code=inline]{site:nothing}[/code] ) - why always generate (save) canonical URLs for new topics - why is e_PAGE or any other way how to find where you are so important?
There is the forum post with ID 226 as an example.
Original metatag uses e_REQUEST_URL as canonical URL. But e_REQUEST_URL for the link to latest post is with parameters too for example /?&p=1 in URL
Fixing this doesn't help because there is next example when this fails: - if you change topic name, then URL is generated from this title.
So now are available those links: [code]https://www.e107sk.com/forum/general-theme-questions/226/gaia-news-solved/?&p=1#post-762 https://www.e107sk.com/forum/general-theme-questions/226/gaia-news-solved/ https://www.e107sk.com/forum/general-theme-questions/226/gaia-news/[/code] etc... (there is a lot of more)
But if you generate canonical URLs (in relative Canonical URLs), all those links have the same canonical URL.
[code]https://www.e107sk.com/forum/general-theme-questions/226/gaia-news/[/code]
because canonical relative URLs are combination entity type and entity ID (in this case forum topic and ID 226).
But this is possible only if you are able to identify entity type and ID correctly. Asking for one way how to do it through all system is probably too much.

It's because now it's hardcoded 24px with in core e107.css

img.e-emoticon {
vertical-align: middle;
border: 0;
width: 24px;
}

To get original 60px you need to add this to theme style.css:

img.e-emoticon {
width: 60px;
}

DONE.

Note: Some of your emoticons has size 800px, you should resize them to 60 px, they needs to be resized by browser and it has influence on time loading.

I abandoned the Links Page plugin for good. I replaced it with the Web Links plugin. You can see it in action on this site.
Web Links plugin was originally an UnNuke plugin (forked from PhpNuke). Because I use e107 as the backend for my still active UnNuke sites, I decided to create e107 version. If it detects the Links Page plugin is in use, it copies its data to new needed tables.

[html]

There 6 states of calendar date:

// 1 - Today, no events
// 2 - Some other day, no events
// 3 - Today with events
// 4 - Some other day with events
// 5 - today with events, one or more of which has recently been added/updated
// 6 - Some other day with events, one or more of which has recently been added/updated

To override theme css for table cells:

.leftmenu-box table.table tr td.case2,
.rightmenu-box table.table tr td.case2 {
background-color: #00008b;
}

.leftmenu-box table.table tr td.case6,
.rightmenu-box table.table tr td.case6 {
background-color: #696969;
}

You need to define other colors too, otherwise cells will be still transparent. 

[/html]

above line: [code=inline]$treeparm = array();[/code]

[b]For news grid[/b] - core code change is needed

there is issue #4092 about this
[b]For all news[/b] - core code change is needed
open news.php in news plugin and change line
[code=inline] private $order = 'news_datestamp';[/code]
It should be enough.

Hi, it should be part of element Clients (Our Premium Clients). On the homepage it should be a normal menu, just remove it from Menu manager. If you need to customize it, then edit the related template.

When the first item field in the element is empty, item is not displayed at all. It is rule.
You can: in elemens/options_clienst.php reorder elements: From:
[code] "item_values" => array( 'item_icon' =>array( 'title' => 'Client brand icon name f.e apple {ITEM_ICON}', 'type' => 'text', 'writeParms' => array('size'=>'xlarge'), 'inuse' => true ), 'item_title' =>array( 'title' => 'Team member name {ITEM_TITLE}', 'type' => 'text', 'writeParms' => array('size'=>'xxlarge'), 'inuse' => true ), [/code]
to: [code] 'item_title' =>array( 'title' => 'Team member name {ITEM_TITLE}', 'type' => 'text', 'writeParms' => array('size'=>'xxlarge'), 'inuse' => true ), 'item_icon' =>array( 'title' => 'Client brand icon name f.e apple {ITEM_ICON}', 'type' => 'text', 'writeParms' => array('size'=>'xlarge'), 'inuse' => true ), [/code]
or you can customize template: templates/jmelements_template.php in: [code]$JMELEMENTS_TEMPLATE['clientlogo']['item'][/code]
remove: [code]<i class="fa fa-{ITEM_ICON}"></i>[/code]
or you can add your own template

[block][b]Example:[/b][/block] [block][b]Breadlife[/b] theme is legacy not responsive theme. But it's div based not with table layout, but without bootstrap it will be not displayed correctly on mobile devices. [/block]
[block]Gallery plugin is new one (for version 2) and so gallery template is bootstrap based template.[/block]
[block]With legacy theme there is special back-compatibility css loaded, so bootstrap grid classes are in action (col-md-3) and images are displayed correctly with themes too.[/block]
[block]If you need to change image size, you need to create change gallery template (in theme folder) and change classes responsible for image width: span3 col-xs-6 col-md-3 [/block]
[block] To make this theme responsive, you need to add bootstrap support there (but it could break other things) or at least some responsive grid. By updating theme according new standards (theme.xml is available) that backcompability css will not be loaded.[/block]

If you insert for example: [prism]{GALLERY_PORTFOLIO: placeholder=1&category=1}[/prism] to your page, final look can be broken, if theme is not prepared for this. There are 2 ways how can be this shortcode displayed. [u][b]1. via template[/b][/u] by default portfolio template is commented. Quick fix: - check if theme uses gallery template - if not, copy gallery plugin template into theme templates folder (templates/gallery/gallery_template.php) - uncomment portfolio template [prism]$GALLERY_TEMPLATE['portfolio']['start'] = ''; $GALLERY_TEMPLATE['portfolio']['item'] = ''; $GALLERY_TEMPLATE['portfolio']['end'] = '';[/prism] Then template way is used, tablerender function is ignored and just fix this template (add col-md-* classes). For example: [prism]$GALLERY_TEMPLATE['portfolio']['start'] = '
'; $GALLERY_TEMPLATE['portfolio']['item'] = '
'; $GALLERY_TEMPLATE['portfolio']['end'] = '
';[/prism] PS. I would use smaller images to save time loading. [u][b]2. via tablerender[/b][/u] If you don't want to mess with template open theme.php add this line to tablerender function: [prism]if($id == "gallery_portfolio") {$style = "gallery_portfolio"; }[/prism] This is case if your theme works only with $style parameter - because gallery portfolio shorcode uses only $id parameter. Then add code for gallery_portfolio value: (This is used for each item, so no class row there) For example: [prism] case "gallery_portfolio": echo "
{$text}
"; break; [/prism]

Если у тебяс есть собственный плагин, ты можете использовать плагин RSS с e_rss.php. в настоящее время e_rss.php для новостей, контента, загрузки, форума, Featurebox, chatbox ...

Steps:
1. created copy of live database 2. moved copy to hosting with test database 3. changing e107_config.php of test site 4. run update 5. run forum update (with option remove old tables, it wasn't use before probably or it didn't work) 6. copy some tables from old test database: - e107_plugin - e107_menus - e107_core - e107_links - e107_generic - e107_online - e107_onlineinfo_cache
7. fix hash of media folder (because using prefs with different database name) - [link=https://www.e107sk.com/knowledge_base/hashed-names-for-media-and-system-folders/?content.50]more info[/link]
8. fix parsing problem with using bbcodes and html code together [link=https://github.com/e107inc/e107/issues/3240]see more[/link]
Time of full update: one hour.
Now to check everything in more details.

[h=4]Preferences related to signature:[/h]
[b]signup_option_signature [/b] Main Preferencies / Signup Page Options/ [i]Signature: [/i]- hide/display/displayed (displaying signature field during signup process)
[b]signature_access[/b] Users/Options/ [i]Signature may be modified by[/i] (editing signature field with editing profile)
[b]sig_once[/b] used in forum shortcodes, not able to set. It should be some forum preference.
[h=4]CONSTANTS (Variables) related to signature:[/h] [b]USERSIGNATURE[/b] - signature of actual logged in user
[h=4]Shortcodes related to signature:[/h] [b]news:[/b] [code=inline]{NEWS_AUTHOR_SIGNATURE}[/code]
[b]signup:[/b] [code=inline]{SIGNUP_SIGNATURE}[/code]
[b]user:[/b] [code=inline]{USER_SIGNATURE}[/code]
[b]usersettings:[/b] [code=inline]{SIGNATURE}[/code] [code=inline]{SIGNATURE_HELP}[/code] - always empty
[b]forum:[/b] [code=inline]{SIGNATURE}[/code] [code=inline]{SIGNATURE=clean}[/code] visible always only for users.
[h=4]Signature editing (shortcodes):[/h] signup: [code]bbarea('signature', '', 'signature','helpb', 'tiny')[/code]
usersetttings: [code]bbarea('signature', $this->var['user_signature'], '', '', 'small')[/code]
[h=4]Signature displaying (shortcodes) [/h]
[b]user profile:[/b] [code]{USER_SIGNATURE} toHTML($this->var['user_signature'], TRUE)[/code]
[b]news author:[/b] [code]{NEWS_AUTHOR_SIGNATURE} toHtml($user['user_signature'], true, 'DESCRIPTION')[/code]
[b]forum post:[/b] [code]{SIGNATURE} toHTML($this->postInfo['user_signature'], true)[/code]

Adding print options has 2 parts: 1. add button with option /link to print displayed page 2. solve printing itself. [h=4]Adding print button[/h] Already existing print button in core: [b]news: - [label=warning]new way[/label][/b] [code=inline]{PRINTICON}[/code] [code=inline]{PRINTICON: class=btn btn-default}[/code] [b]forum: - [label=warning]semiold way[/label][/b] [code=inline]{PRINTITEM}[/code] [code]PRINTICON require_once(e_HANDLER.'emailprint_class.php'); return emailprint::render_emailprint($plugin_name, $record_id, 2, $parm);[/code] note: this shortcode can be used only for news. There are attemps to make it as general solution, but it's not finished, print.php still counts of text "plugin" in first parameter. [code]{PRINTITEM} using single shortcode {PRINT_ITEM=Print^plugin:forum. $record_id}[/code] for any of this way link for printing is created this way: [code=inline]href='".e_HTTP."print.php?".$print.".".$record_id."' where $print is 'news' or plugin:$plugin_name [/code] For custom plugin is maybe better direct method ([label=warning]old way[/label]) [i]Note: I don't see point to call shortcode, then template for next shortcode inside.[/i] Example: [code=inline]{REVIEWER_VIEW_PRINT}[/code] - custom shortcode [code]SC_BEGIN REVIEWER_VIEW_PRINT global $reviewer_reviewer_ep; $reviewer_print .= " "; return $reviewer_print; SC_END[/code] Note: There is still used [code=inline]ICONPRINT with path THEME."images/".ICONPRINT[/code] or [code=inline]e_IMAGE_ABS."generic/printer.png";[/code] and hardcoded glyphicon icons: [code=inline][/code] [h=4]Printing itself[/h] Printing is managed by print.php file. Each printable plugin has to have [b]e_emailprint.php [/b] addons. Function print_item() defines what is printed. News are exception, news are reading directly in print.php and news_template is used for output. Print.php can use [code=inline]THEME.'print_template.php'[/code] there is no core print_template.php file. If template doesn't exist, it just display print content with white background and button with [code=inline]window.print()[/code]. No idea when this happens. I thought it was caused with some update, but I have the site with 2.2.0 and I had to fix it. Weird thing is that this site was updated 9th May, I added last content 10th May without any problems. No changes, no updating after it and yesterday my plugins were uninstalled. So if this would be caused manual update, it would happen sooner.
An easy fix is to install plugins again but then you will be lost your preferences and they will return to default. Of course, if you remember what you have installed.
Don't go to Menu manager because you lost your menus too then.
The correct fix is: - go to PhpMyAdmin - find core preferences plug_installed and copy it somewhere to have a list of installed plugins [i] Note: you can get this list from admin area too Tools/Database/plug_installed[/i]
- then find table prefix_plugins and change installed flag from 0 to 1. Some plugins could be installed (news), some not (pm, featurebox etc). One by one.
This way is everything back.
By the way. It happened on this site too some weeks ago. At that time I installed plugins again. Not sure if I set all prefs back as they were before. Only some days ago I found that I forgot to install PM plugin.
Thanks, that worked. Must have been my array/query

  • '.LAN_SETTINGS.'

I am trying to keep the readme file actual but it is sometimes difficult.
Important:
If there is a folder with "updated" in the name, it means that some errors were fixed, but nobody hasn't needed/supported yet future updates.
If there is a folder with "_trashed" in the name, it means that either plugin is beyond repairing or there is somewhere an updated version with further development.

Either there are listed in GitHub repository or check release to see if they are there available for zip download.
